intro: Vernonanthura menthifolia, commonly known as the mint-leaved violets, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly in regions of the Appalachian Mountains. The plant is characterized by its delicate, violet-colored flowers and aromatic, mint-scented leaves. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. Vernonanthura menthifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a habitat for pollinators.
